image.altText: man in a suit next to a woman in red jacket and a younger man in a black shirt casting their vote

props.synopsis: The party leaders have both cast their votes in the federal election, Albanese in his electorate of Grayndler and Dutton in the contentious seat of Dickson. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese, Dutton cast votes with families in home electorates

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with members of the Labor faithful.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton make eleventh hour trips to South Australia, where both have targeted the most marginal seat in the state.

title.children: Leaders target key SA seats in final days of election campaign

image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: The infamous bank building in the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: The nephew of one of the "bodies-in-the-barrels" murder victims has called on South Australia's Parole Board not to release convicted killer James Vlassakis, who has made a bid for parole.

title.children: Snowtown killer's parole bid 'slap in the face', says nephew of victim

image.altText: A 15-year-old girl holding an AFL football with a players behind her on an oval

props.synopsis: Aussie rules teams across the Eyre Peninsula say a ruling by the SANFL that 15-year-old girls cannot play in the boys' competition this season has been handled "very poorly", with some players told mid-match.

title.children: Anger as young female footy players banned from boys' competition

image.altText: The back of a firefighter wearing a yellow jacket with 'MFS Fire Rescue' written on it

props.synopsis: Firefighters are having to wear clothing contaminated by carcinogens because their equipment is being stored alongside trucks emitting diesel exhaust, according to their union.

title.children: Firefighting uniforms in storage exposed to carcinogens, union claims

image.altText: Rows of vineyards stretch across golden plains, seen through the leaves of a tree in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The need for development in the region is clear, but the Barossa Valley's major stakeholders disagree about the way it needs to be done.

title.children: The Barossa Valley is being pushed in many different directions – but where will it end up?

image.altText: A QantasLink plane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: The cost of flights is taking its toll on travellers on the Eyre Peninsula where a local council paying a high price for its airport is begging for more federal support.

title.children: Costs and cancellations adding up for fed-up flyers in regional SA

image.altText: A pair of knights in shining armour do battle with swords.

props.synopsis: Handmade encampments and living history displays of the Middle Ages are being erected in the Paracombe as medieval carnivals increase in popularity across Australia.

title.children: Medieval fair to bring 'real jousting' and sword-wielding knights to Adelaide Hills

image.altText: A player holding a ball preparing to throw. Two players go head to head on the side

props.synopsis: Star Adelaide Thunderbirds defender Shamera Sterling-Humphrey will miss the remainder of the national netball season as she prepares to welcome her first child, with South African Sanmarie Visser announced as her replacement.

title.children: Adelaide Thunderbirds star 'so excited' to be welcoming first child

image.altText: One adult emu followed by five emu chicks on a gravel road next to a red brick house.

props.synopsis: A wildlife rescuer is urging people to take caution as drought conditions force emus to migrate from their usual outback habitat into Broken Hill in search of refuge and water.

title.children: Emu mobs drawn into city as outback habitat dries out

image.altText: A woman with dyed hair and a man with a neck tattoo huddle together for a selfie.

props.synopsis: A man and a woman will spend five months in jail for making fake $50 and $100 notes after deciding that it was an "easy" way to make money.

title.children: Jail for couple inspired to counterfeit cash after watching TikTok video

image.altText: Adrian Portelli holds several 100 dollar bills in his hand

props.synopsis: The property investor and social media influencer will stand trial in an Adelaide court later this year after pleading not guilty to several charges of conducting an unlawful lottery.

title.children: Adrian Portelli ordered to stand trial over unlawful lottery allegations

image.altText: A small aeroplane at rest in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The ATSB has found that the 22-year-old man's Cessna aerodynamically stalled while he was carrying out mustering work.

title.children: Young pilot's aircraft stalled before deadly crash, report finds

image.altText: A green sign for Hydrogen Power SA erected on a vacant arid site in Whyalla

props.synopsis: The SA government insists it remains committed to hydrogen as a source of fuel over the long term, but the opposition says a proposed project near Whyalla is now "in tatters".

title.children: Hydrogen and water projects 'in tatters', SA opposition says

image.altText: A woman at SA parliament staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: The SA government's apology in parliament to people affected by the use of pelvic mesh — including "for the pain, embarrassment and gaslighting they've endured" — needs to be followed by practical steps, an advocate says.

title.children: Pelvic mesh apology a 'first step', but advocate calls for lifelong care

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: The real challenge for the outback community is beginning as floodwaters start to clear, with critical infrastructure showing signs of serious damage.

title.children: Long road to recovery for Innamincka as receding floodwaters expose damage

image.altText: Six glasses of red wine being held up for a toast, the drinkers' hands are visible

props.synopsis: Australian wine began flowing back into China last year when tariffs were removed, but overall exports are declining significantly.

title.children: Australian wine exports on the slide as world drinks less

image.altText: Man in light blue suit stands against book shelf

props.synopsis: With a hub based at heritage-listed Ayers House, South Australia's History Festival begins today and runs for the month of May.

title.children: South Australia's History Festival launches with nearly 600 events

props.synopsis: Wills was Labor heartland, but now the seat that belonged to Bob Hawke is squarely in the marginal column.

title.children: Why Melbourne’s inner north has Labor worried

image.altText: graffiti sprayed on the walls of a western sydney mosque that read hamas albo and albo liar

props.synopsis: NSW Police confirms it is investigating a vandalism attack at the Rooty Hill Masjid after it was defaced with the words: "No migrants", "Hamas Albo", and "Albo liar".

title.children: 'Offensive graffiti' targeting PM, migrants appears at Sydney mosque

image.altText: A sillouette of trump stands in front of the letters NPR

props.synopsis: The White House, in a social media posting announcing the order, says broadcasters PBS and NPR "receive millions from taxpayers to spread radical, woke propaganda disguised as 'news'".

title.children: Trump signs executive order cutting funding for public broadcasters

image.altText: A mournful woman closes her eyes as her heads tilts downwards.

props.synopsis: The mother of Mackenzie Anderson, 21, says she plans to push for reform in her daughter's name after the man who stabbed her 78 times will be eligible for parole in 13 years.

title.children: Mum's outrage over 'light' sentence handed to daughter's DV murderer

image.altText: Chaos unfolds at Sydney's Randwick Racecourse at the site where students were sitting exams for gifted students

props.synopsis: Parents say logistical issues became clear when they attempted to drop off their children sitting exams for selective schools and opportunity classes at Canterbury Park and Randwick Racecourses.

title.children: Riot squad called to control parents, students at Sydney exam sites

image.altText: An aerial view shows a large sinkhole that formed when a sinkhole that swallowed a truck and a man

props.synopsis: The sinkhole, which was caused by corroded sewerage pipes, was first discovered in February and is now at least 40 metres wide.

title.children: Body of Japanese driver swallowed by sinkhole recovered months later

image.altText: A graphic shows a smartphone screen showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Housing, cost of living, health and Australia's energy future have been front and centre this election campaign. Here's what the Vote Compass data tells us about where respondents stand on key issues.

title.children: The key issues identified by Vote Compass as 1.2m use election tool

image.altText: A grainy photo of a white large bead-shaped hunk of metal with 'CCCP' emblazoned in red on the sides.

props.synopsis: Scientists are keeping an eye on Kosmos 482, which is forecast to plunge back to Earth next week. We just don't know exactly when or where it will land.

title.children: Old Soviet spacecraft expected to crash back to Earth next week

image.altText: Antony Green, a 65-year-old man with white hair, poses in an office hallway, wearing a black stylised Indigenous flag jumper.

props.synopsis: Millions of Australians know him as "that election guy", but ABC's outgoing chief election analyst is also an avid music lover, as Zan Rowe discovered.

title.children: Antony Green may be a political nerd, but his music taste is premier

image.altText: Justin Longmuir looks to his right during a Dockers AFL match.

props.synopsis: Justin Longmuir admits he and his players will be forced to do some soul searching after the humiliating 61-point thrashing handed out by the Saints on Friday night.

title.children: 'What did I get wrong?' Dockers coach Longmuir left searching for answers

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob sits in a black dress with a white collar holding a guitar, smiling.

props.synopsis: While best known for 90s hits 'Supermodel' and 'I Kissed A Girl', Jill Sobule's career spanned three decades, 12 albums and more.

title.children: Jill Sobule, singer behind I Kissed A Girl and Supermodel, dead at 66

image.altText: Person

props.synopsis: Voting in Australia is compulsory for everyone aged 18 and older who has enrolled to vote. But what happens if you don't get to the polling booth?

title.children: What are the penalties for not voting in the election?

image.altText: A man in front of a billboard which says "the parties are the problem"

props.synopsis: Hothouse Magazine has spent more than $400,000 on political Meta ads since February. Analysis shows that over 30 days it mostly targeted postcodes in seats with Climate 200-supported independent candidates.

title.children: Little-known entity comparing Dutton to Trump spends $400,000 on ads

image.altText: The two men standing shoulder to shoulder, Pope Francis does not look amused

props.synopsis: The conclave will be a "fight for the soul of the Catholic Church" between those who saw promise in the modernising changes Pope Francis made and those "who hated him for it".

title.children: MAGA's 'vicious fight' for the 'soul of the Catholic church'

image.altText: A man outside his Qld home standing next to the fence at the front of the house

props.synopsis: As Australians head to the ballot box, the lack of affordable housing is posing a major issue for many. But the debate about how to constrain prices remains a sore point because millions are home owners and many have built their wealth through property.

title.children: Home owners far outnumber first-time buyers, so pollies ‘do the math’

image.altText: Koren Helbig stands in her vegetable garden holding small pots containing vegetable seedlings. She is smiling.

props.synopsis: As a lazy gardener, I like plants that give me the most food for the least effort. These are my top winter picks.

title.children: Herbs and veggies to plant now to reduce your food bill in winter
